title: Yellowing Leaves
description: Learn what causes leaves to turn yellow and how to fix it.
steps: Check soil moisture — overwatering is a common cause
Ensure the pot has drainage holes
Look for signs of pests like spider mites
Move plant to a brighter location if light is low
tips: Let soil dry out between waterings
Avoid cold drafts
Remove affected leaves to redirect energy

title: Wilting Leaves
description: Wilting can mean too little or too much water.
steps: Stick your finger into the soil to check moisture
Water if dry, reduce watering if soggy
Check for root rot by gently removing the plant from pot
Increase humidity if air is too dry
tips: Always water thoroughly but infrequently
Use a moisture meter for accuracy

title: Brown Leaf Tips
description: Brown tips are often a sign of low humidity or water quality.
steps: Increase humidity with misting or pebble trays
Use filtered or rain water instead of tap water
Trim brown tips with clean scissors
tips: Avoid letting soil dry out completely
Group plants to create a humid microclimate

title: Leggy Growth
description: Plants become leggy when they don’t get enough light.
steps: Move plant to a brighter location
Use a grow light if needed
Prune leggy stems to encourage bushier growth
tips: Rotate your plant weekly for even light exposure
South-facing windows offer strongest light

title: Root Rot
description: Overwatering often leads to root rot, a serious issue.
steps: Unpot the plant and check roots — mushy and brown means rot
Cut off all affected roots with sterile scissors
Repot in fresh, well-draining soil
Water only when soil is dry
tips: Use pots with drainage holes
Avoid letting plant sit in excess water

title: Pests: Spider Mites
description: Spider mites leave fine webs and cause speckled leaves.
steps: Inspect leaves for fine webbing and specks
Wipe leaves with soapy water or neem oil
Isolate the plant to avoid spreading
Repeat treatment weekly until gone
tips: Mist often – spider mites hate humidity
Regularly check under leaves

title: Powdery Mildew
description: This fungal disease shows as white powder on leaves.
steps: Remove affected leaves
Improve air circulation around plant
Spray with diluted milk or baking soda solution
tips: Avoid overhead watering
Ensure space between plants

title: No Growth
description: If your plant hasn’t grown in months, here’s what to check.
steps: Ensure the plant is getting enough light
Fertilize during active seasons
Repot if rootbound
Avoid overwatering during dormant months
tips: Growth slows in winter – be patient
Use balanced fertilizer in spring/summer

title: Drooping Leaves After Watering
description: Surprisingly, drooping can happen even after watering.
steps: Check for overwatering symptoms
Ensure pot drains properly
Lift plant out and inspect roots
tips: Don't water on a schedule — check the soil first
Terracotta pots dry faster than plastic

title: Leaves Curling Inward
description: Curling leaves are often a sign of heat stress or pests.
steps: Move plant out of direct hot sunlight
Increase humidity around the plant
Check for thrips or aphids
tips: Don't mist in direct sunlight
Neem oil is great for pest prevention
